OVO Kenakan Biaya Transfer, Simak Aturannya Menurut BI
05 Nov 2019, 03:11 by Bisnis.com, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Mulai 12 Desember 2019 layanan finansial teknologi, Ovo, akan mengenakan biaya transfer ke bank sebesar Rp 2.500 per transaksi. Sebelumnya dompet digital di bawah bendera PT Visionet Internasional tidak memungut biaya untuk transaksi tersebut.
Direktur Eksekutif Departemen Komunikasi Bank Indonesia Onny Widjanarko mengatakan bahwa dalam aturan tidak diatur biaya transfer antarbank. Hal itu dengan catatan lembaga penyelenggara transfer atau perusahaan switching mengumumkan biaya tersebut kepada konsumen.
Bank sentral hanya mewajibkan penyelenggara jasa berizin sesuai ketentuan. “Penyelenggara jasa transfer dana wajib berizin. Ada aturannya di PBI (Peraturan Bank Indonesia), pemrosesan transaksi pembayaran,” katanya.
Sejauh ini selain Ovo, sejumlah perusahaan teknologi juga memiliki layanan transfer antarbank. Di anataranya adalah Dana, Gopay, hingga LinkAja juga menyematkan layanan transfer antarbank sebagai salah satu fasilitas. Sementara itu, aplikasi bernama Flip memiliki fokus pada layanan transfer gratis antar bank.
Onny menyebutkan bahwa seluruh aplikasi tersebut telah memiliki izin dari Bank Indonesia. Di dalam surat edaran Bank Indonesia perihal penyelenggaraan pemrosesan transaksi pembayaran, bank atau lembaga selain bank berhak mengajukan izin sebagai perusahaan switching.
Kendati Ovo mengenakan biaya transfer bank, tarif yang dibebankan kepada pengguna tersebut masih lebih murah dibandingkan dengan biaya transfer yang diberlakukan oleh perbankan.
Ketika melakukan transaksi transfer antarbank, nasabah umumnya akan dikenakan biaya administrasi sebesar Rp 6.500. Sejumlah bank besar, seperti BCA, Mandiri, BRI, BNI, dan lainnya mengenakan tarif Rp 6.500 untuk setiap kegiatan transfer baik melalui anjungan tunai mandiri (ATM) maupun mobile banking.
text:
OVO Imposes Transfer Fees, See the Rules According to BI
05 Nov 2019, 03:11 by Bisnis.com, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Starting December 12, 2019, financial technology services, Ovo, will charge a bank transfer fee of Rp 2,500 per transaction. Previously, the digital wallet under the PT Visionet International flag did not charge fees for the transaction.
Bank Indonesia Communications Department Executive Director Onny Widjanarko said that the rules do not regulate interbank transfer fees. That is with a note that the transfer provider or the switching company announces these costs to consumers.
The central bank only requires that licensed service providers comply with the provisions. "Providers of fund transfer services must be licensed. There are rules in PBI (Bank Indonesia Regulation), processing payment transactions, "he said.
So far besides Ovo, a number of technology companies also have interbank transfer services. Among them are Dana, Gopay, and LinkAja, which also includes interbank transfer services as a facility. Meanwhile, an application called Flip has a focus on free interbank transfer services.
Onny said that all of these applications had licenses from Bank Indonesia. In a Bank Indonesia circular concerning the processing of payment transactions, banks or institutions other than banks have the right to apply for licenses as switching companies.
Even though Ovo charges a bank transfer fee, the rate charged to the user is still cheaper than the transfer fee imposed by banks.
When conducting an interbank transfer transaction, customers will generally be charged an administration fee of IDR 6,500. A number of large banks, such as BCA, Mandiri, BRI, BNI, and others charge a rate of Rp 6,500 for each transfer activity either through automated teller machines (ATMs) or mobile banking.
